result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto J Juarez Nieves Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
AMENDED 6/13/2016:  DEFENDANT IS ELIGIBLE FOR CHALLENGE INCARCERATION AND THE SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.
AMENDED 2/5/2018:  SENTENCE CREDIT FOR 204 DAYS WAS GRANTED IF REVOKED.
Concurrent with: 14CF799
Court would approve early termination only if ALL restitution has been paid.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random urine screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Vocational counseling, cognitive intervention, criminal thinking course and/or other treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with victim.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
Pay restitution as listed in 14CF799.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - nonworking hours with standard release conditions.
FORTHWITH.

Motion for an Extension of Time for Filing the Defendant's Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief, filed with State of Wisconsin Court of Appeals. (Denied per Order Court of Appeals dated 4/11/17)

Before Reilly, P.J.
The defendant, Roberto J. Juarez Nieves, Jr., moves pro se to extend the time to file a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief from his convictions of February 6, 2015. It has been over two years since the notice of intent was due. "The longer the extension that is sought, the greater the showing that is generally required to satisfy us that there is good cause for granting it." State v. Quackenbush, 2005 WI App 2, [Par.]11, 278 Wis. 2d 611, 692 N.W.2d 340. We are not persuaded that Juarez Nieves' motion establishes good cause for the requested relief. Therefore,
IT IS ORDERED that the motion to extend the time for filing a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is denied.
Clerk's response to the Defendant's pro se Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Roberto J Juarez Nieves in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Statement by victim.  Arguments by the defense.  Statement by defendant.  

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- Total sentence: 15 years (Initial Confinement: 10 years, Extended Supervision: 5 years) CONCURRENT with 14CF799.  STAYED
- 10 years Probation.  Court would approve early termination only if ALL restitution in 14CF799 has been paid.
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Vocational counseling, cognitive intervention, criminal thinking course and/or any other treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with victim.  Maintain full-time employment. Pay restitution as listed in 14CF799.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
CONDITION TIME: 1 year - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence FORTHWITH.
